channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Explosion at a Pennsylvania nursing home kills at least 2, governor says
item.description: The explosion collapsed a part of the building and happened just as a utility crew had been on site looking for a gas leak at Bristol Health & Rehab Center in Bristol Township, just outside Philadelphia.
item.content:encoded:
The explosion collapsed a part of the building and happened just as a utility crew had been on site looking for a gas leak at Bristol Health & Rehab Center in Bristol Township, just outside Philadelphia.

(Image credit: Monica Herndon/The Philadelphia Inquirer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Supreme Court rules against Trump in National Guard case
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: In Memoriam 2025: The Musicians We Lost
item.description: D'Angelo. Brian Wilson. Sly Stone. We lost these greats and so many more in 2025 — singers, producers, conductors and writers whose departures gave us a pang of loss, but whose art still lifts us up.
item.content:encoded:
D'Angelo. Brian Wilson. Sly Stone. We lost these greats and so many more in 2025 — singers, producers, conductors and writers whose departures gave us a pang of loss, but whose art still lifts us up.

(Image credit: Michael Ochs Archives)
item.dc:creator: Lars Gotrich

item.title: A diplomat's tears, 200 snake bites, drone pix: Goats and Soda's top stories in 2025
item.description: Our most popular global health and development stories in 2025 covered the human impact of the upheaval in U.S. foreign aid, surprising news about familiar diseases and the beauty of earth captured by drone cameras.
item.content:encoded:
Our most popular global health and development stories in 2025 covered the human impact of the upheaval in U.S. foreign aid, surprising news about familiar diseases and the beauty of earth captured by drone cameras.

(Image credit: Clockwise from top left: U.S. Embassy Zambia; Mohammad Ataei Mohammadi; Claire Harbage/NPR; Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: Student loan borrowers in default may soon see their wages garnished
item.description: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paused the practice.
item.content:encoded: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paused the practice.
item.dc:creator: Sequoia Carrillo

item.title: Justice Department releases more Epstein files and some mention Trump
item.description: The Department of Justice has been publicly posting files related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation since Friday.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Justice has been publicly posting files related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation since Friday.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: A top-10 list can't contain all the great TV of 2025
item.description: TV critic David Bianculli says 2025 offered so many great shows he couldn't narrow them down. But in a year of intense TV, Netflix's haunting series Adolescence, stands apart.
item.content:encoded: TV critic David Bianculli says 2025 offered so many great shows he couldn't narrow them down. But in a year of intense TV, Netflix's haunting series Adolescence, stands apart.
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli

item.title: Vince Zampella, video game pioneer behind megahit Call of Duty, dies at 55
item.description: One of Vince Zampella's crowning achievements was the creation of the Call of Duty franchise, which has sold more than half a billion games worldwide.
item.content:encoded:
One of Vince Zampella's crowning achievements was the creation of the Call of Duty franchise, which has sold more than half a billion games worldwide.

(Image credit: Paul Sakuma)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Scientists learn more about how human embryos implant using artificial wombs
item.description: Scientists have developed an experimental way to study how human embryos implant in a uterus, which may provide new insights into why miscarriages occur and how they can be prevented.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have developed an experimental way to study how human embryos implant in a uterus, which may provide new insights into why miscarriages occur and how they can be prevented.

(Image credit: Matteo Molè at the Babraham Institute.)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: 2025: The images that stayed with us
item.description: Photographs help us look back on the moments that defined the year. Taken by NPR photojournalists nationwide, this collection goes beyond the headlines to reveal quietly powerful human stories.
item.content:encoded:
Photographs help us look back on the moments that defined the year. Taken by NPR photojournalists nationwide, this collection goes beyond the headlines to reveal quietly powerful human stories.

(Image credit: Tyler Russell)
item.dc:creator: Meredith Nierman
